page.title: 02THE NORTH HILL TRAIL.
page.content: THE UNFENCED AREAS OF NORTH HILL ARE ACCESSIBLE TO THE PUBLIC BECAUSE THEY ARE OWNED BY THREE PUBLIC BODIES:- THE NATIONAL TRUST, THE SOMERSET COUNTY COUNCIL AND THE WEST SOMERSET DISTRICT COUNCIL. RECENTLY THE NATIONAL PARK HAS ACQUIRED A PART OF NORTH HILL. NORTH HILL HAS A LONG MILITARY HISTORY. AS LONG AGO AS THE IRON AGE, DEFENCE POSTS WERE CONSTRUCTED THERE. BURY CASTLE(ABOVE SELWORTHY) IS A GOOD EXAMPLE OF THE REMAINS OF A HILL FORT. THERE ARE ALSO SEVERAL EXCAVATED BARROWS (BURIAL MOUNDS) DOTTED ABOUT THE HILL. ABOVE THE RUINS OF THE WEST MYNE FARM IS EVIDENCE OF ANOTHER DEFENCE POST WHICH WAS PROBABLY USED TO PROTECT IRON AGE MAN'S LIVESTOCK. HORSES WERE BOUGHT FROM LOCAL FARMERS, GIVEN INITAL TRAINING AND THEN MARSHELLED TO THE STATION YARD FOR TRANSPORTAION TO THE FRONT.
